resources.string:
• An American politician 
 • Democratic candidate for President in 2016 election 
 • 67th United States Secretary of State from 2009 to 
 2013 
 • Served as a United States Senator from New York 
 from 2001 to 2009 
 • The wife of the 42nd President of the United States 
 Bill Clinton

• An American politician 
 • Junior United States senator from Vermont 
 • Democratic candidate for President in 2016 election 
 • A member of the Democratic Party since 2015 
 • Longest-serving independent in U.S. congressional 
 history 
 • Ranking minority member on the Senate Budget 
 Committee 
 • Chair of the Senate Veterans' Affairs Committee for 2 
 years.
• An American politician \n • Junior United States Senator from Texas \n • Republican candidate for President in 2016 election.

• An American businessman, politician, television 
 personality, author 
 • Republican candidate for President in 2016 election 
 • Chairman and President of The Trump Organization 
 • Founder of Trump Entertainment Resorts, now owned 
 by Carl Icahn.
CHEROKEE LANE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL \n 9000 25th Avenue, \n Adelphi, MD 20783

• All or most members of a given political body are 
 chosen 
 • Held for a nation's primary legislative body 
 • distinguished from by-elections and local elections.

• A regularly scheduled election where both the 
 president and all members of the national 
 legislature are elected at the same time 
 • Sometimes refers to special elections held to fill 
 prematurely vacated positions 
 • May also include elections for local officials.

• Involve competition between at least two parties 
 • Occur every two to six years 
 • Reference to and distinguished from primaries or 
 caucuses 
 • Caucuses are Intra-party elections meant to 
 select a party's candidate for a particular race.
• Occurs every four years on Election Day \n • Held the first Tuesday after the first Monday in \n November.

• November 8, 2016 
 • Begin with the primary elections and caucuses and 
 moves to nominating conventions 
 • The nominee announces a Vice Presidential running 
 mate 
 • Candidates campaign across the country 
 • Participate in debates with candidates from other 
 parties.

• Americans cast their vote for President 
 • Popular vote does not determine the winner 
 • Presidential elections use the Electoral College 
 • A candidate must receive a majority of electoral votes 
 to win 
 • In the event no candidate receives the majority, 
 the House of Representatives chooses the 
 President and the Senate chooses the 
 Vice President.
You must register to vote by October 16th. Vote in the general election on November 8th.
Enter the name of this notification
